intro: Dicliptera deltica, commonly known as the salt marsh grass, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions. It is a perennial herb that thrives in saline and brackish wetlands. The plant has slender, erect stems and narrow, linear leaves that help reduce water loss. Its small, clustered inflorescences produce tiny flowers that are wind-pollinated. Dicliptera deltica plays an important role in stabilizing coastal soils and providing habitat for various wetland organisms.
